rows.title: How do I talk to people on Discord?
rows.content:
You can talk to users on Discord by linking your existing Discord account with the chat.horse Discord bridge. Visit this page for instructions.
Or this page for a general introduction to bridges.

rows.title: How do I talk to people on Telegram?
rows.content:
You can talk to users on Telegram by linking your existing Telegram account with the chat.horse Telegram bridge.
Visit this page for instructions: https://chat.horse/bridging/discord
Or this page for a general introduction to bridges: https://chat.horse/bridges

rows.title: Is there a Desktop app?
rows.content: Visit https://chat.horse/desktop for a Desktop version of the web app. It runs on Linux, Mac and Windows.

rows.title: Is there a Mobile app?
rows.content: Visit https://chat.horse/mobile for mobile apps. Both Android and iOS supported.

rows.title: What if I don't like the chat.horse clients?
rows.content: chat.horse runs on top of Matrix, so technically any Matrix client can be used. See here for more options, or build your own!

rows.title: How do I add my own emotes?
rows.content:
To add your own emote images, simply open up Settings and navigate to the Emotes tab.



Click on your username and then select Settings.



Click on the Emotes tab.



Click Add Emote, then set the Emote Name (ex. :happy:), then click Select Image.

When you've uploaded an image, and the Emote MXC URL field is filled with a URL, you're done! Close Settings and try to use your emote in the chat field.

rows.title: What technology does chat.horse use?
rows.content:
chat.horse is built on top of Matrix, an open standard for communication. This grants us access to talk to anyone else that's using the same network. Think of it like email. Even though you're a Gmail user, you can still talk to people on Hotmail.

The actual web/desktop and mobile apps are customized versions of Riot, with the desktop app being a fork of the version customized by ponies.im.

The bridges for Discord and Telegram are instances of mx-puppet-discord and mautrix-telegram respectively.

This website is built using Gatsby.

Source code for everything is available at https://github.com/chat-horse.
